DOC.HEAD: Southeastern Asset Increases Saatchi Stake to 11.2 Percent
DOC.TEXT: Saatchi & Saatchi Co. PLC, the world's largest advertising holding company, said Wednesday that the investment company Southeastern Asset Management has increased its stake in the troubled company to 11.2 percent. Southeastern, based in Memphis, Tenn., had previously declared on Sept. 18 that it owned a 10.2 percent stake in Saatchi. Its president O. Mason Hawkins was quoted Wednesday in the Saatchi news release as saying the stake-building indicated his company's support for Saatchi's management. ``We are long-term investors who seek to find undervalued companies, which have management determined to achieve substantial profit improvement and to enhance shareholder value,'' Hawkins said. Southeastern has increased its shareholding to 17.788 million ordinary shares, Saatchi said. A Saatchi official, who didn't want to be identified, said company officials ``welcome long-term holders in the company and Hawkins is obviously in that category.'' Some analysts have speculated that Southeastern is taking its stake in the hope that Saatchi eventually will become the subject of a bid. Earlier this month, Saatchi reported a net loss of 58.5 million pounds, or $94 million, for the year ended Sept. 30, reflecting troubles in its consulting business which the company has placed up for sale. It recently appointed a new chief executive, French businessman Robert Louis-Dreyfus.
